definition: Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth

sentences.english: We are Abraham's descendants in the faith.
sentences.chinese: 在信德内，我们都是亚巴郎的后裔。

sentences.english: Consequently, those who have faith are blessed along with Abraham who had faith.
sentences.chinese: 可见那些具有信德的人，与有信德的亚巴郎同蒙祝福。

sentences.english: Q2: Approximately how many years were there between Abraham and Moses?
sentences.chinese: 亚巴郎和梅瑟大约相隔多久？

sentences.english: Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.
sentences.chinese: 在依撒格断乳的那天，亚巴郎摆了盛宴。

sentences.english: And the days of Abraham's life were a hundred and seventy-five years.
sentences.chinese: 亚巴郎一生的岁月共是一百七十五岁。

sentences.english: Abraham bowed down before the people of the land.
sentences.chinese: 亚巴郎又在当地人民面前下拜。

sentences.english: And so patiently enduring he obtained the promise.
sentences.chinese: 这样亚巴郎因耐心等待，而获得了恩许。

sentences.english: For I tell you that God is able of these stones to raise up children to Abraham.
sentences.chinese: 天主能从这些石头给亚巴郎兴起子孙来。

definition: Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
